#RMC-14 Rules
If you are unable to click any of the links, use the in-game guidebook version.
##Recent Changes Read the relevant sections for the entire text. - Naming rule additions and clarifications. - Marine law. - (Protect Detainees) Removed all references to permabrig and executions in rules. Refer to marine law for punishments. - (Military and Command) Further clarified the permissions of execution and the role of the CO.
##Admin Decisions Are Final. - Rules are enforced as intended. Every example of a rule break cannot be written, thus enforcement is subject to admin interpretation of the rule’s intention. - Admins may handle rule breaks through in-character consequences at their discretion. This does not apply to zero tolerance rules. - You may file a staff complaint with head staff if you find the decision to be incorrect.
##General Information Disconnecting from or ignoring/evading admin-helps will result in an appeal only ban. This is to prevent bad actors from avoiding issues. If you need to leave urgently, let us know and it will be considered in your appeal.
All of the below rules apply at all times, including between rounds.
These rules are neither exactly SS14 or CM13 and should be read in their entirety.

## Zero Tolerance Rules You are liable to be banned without warning for breaking these rules. - [textlink="Click here to read the zero tolerance rules." link="RMCZeroTolerance"]
## Core Rules These are the general rules of RMC14. Click them for more information. - [textlink="1. These are English servers, please only use english." link="RMCLanguage"] - [textlink="2. Do not use multiple accounts, or alt accounts, and do not share accounts." link="RMCMultikey"] - [textlink="3. Follow the rules of escalation against non-hostiles." link="RMCRulesEscalation"] - [textlink="4. Don't use information gained from outside your character's knowledge." link="RMCMetaknowledge"] - [textlink="5. Don't antagonize your team." link="RMCKindness"] - [textlink="6. Don't harass or target players across rounds." link="RMCMetagrudging"] - [textlink="7. Don't quit a head role without notice." link="RMCCommandRoles"] - 8. Don't disconnect if you do not get the role/kit you want, be considerate.
## Riots, Mutiny - [textlink="1. Mutinies, riots and similar activity require admin permission." link="RMCMutinies"]
## Military and Command These rules also apply to any individual who is promoted or is acting in the place of a MP/Command role (unless they are a member of a hostile force). - [textlink="1. Marine Law." link="RMCMarineLaw"] - [textlink="2. Command and MP are held to a higher standard of play." link="RMCHigherStandards"] - [textlink="3. MP should try to remain non-lethal and effect arrests, except in specific special circumstances." link="RMCLethalForce"] - [textlink="4. MP will be expected to answer for use of lethal force." link="RMCLethalForceConsequences"] - [textlink="5. MP are expected to protect detainees in their custody to the best of their ability." link="RMCProtectDetainees"] - Only with the approval of a whitelisted CO, high command, or the approval of both the acting commander and CMP, may an execution may be approved. - Only a whitelisted CO or high command may pardon a sentence. - Permissions of a CO are not passed down. The acting commander is never a Commanding Officer.
